XML stands for Extensible Markup Language. It is a markup language much like HTML and was designed to store and transport data. XML was designed to be both human- and machine-readable.
The XML declaration is the first line of an XML document and specifies the XML version (1.0), and the character encoding (UTF-8).
XML elements are the building blocks of XML documents. An element has a start tag, content, and an end tag. The start tag and end tag are also referred to as an element container.
XML attributes provide additional information about elements. They appear inside the start tag of an element, and consist of a name/value pair. The attribute value must be quoted.
XML comments are similar to HTML comments. They are used to add notes and comments to an XML document. XML comments are not displayed in the web browsers.

CDATA stands for Character Data. CDATA is used to escape blocks of text containing characters which would otherwise be recognized as markup. CDATA sections begin with the string <![CDATA[ and end with ]]>.
XML validation is the process of checking a document written in XML (eXtensible Markup Language) to confirm that it is both well-formed and also

A well-formed XML document is a document that is syntactically correct, i.e. it to be valid XML. It must have a single root element, and all elements must be properly nested. The document must also contain properly encoded legal XML characters.

A DTD defines the structure and the legal elements and attributes of an XML document. A DTD can be declared inline inside an XML document, or as an external reference. A DTD is declared in a document type declaration.
XML Schema is an XML-based alternative to DTD. It describes the structure of an XML document. The XML Schema language is also referred to as XML Schema Definition (XSD).

XSLT stands for XSL Transformations. XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents into other XML documents, or other formats such as HTML for web pages, plain text or XSL Formatting Objects, which may subsequently be converted to other formats, such as PDF, PostScript and PNG.
XPath is a language for addressing parts of an XML document, designed to be used by both XSLT and XPointer. XPath is a major element in the XSLT standard.
XQuery is a query language designed to query XML data. XQuery is to XML what SQL is to database tables. XQuery is a major element in the XSLT standard.
XLink is a language for creating hyperlinks in XML documents. XLink is a major element in the XSLT standard.
XPointer is a language for addressing parts of an XML document. XPointer is a major element in the XSLT standard.
XInclude is a language for creating XML documents from multiple documents. XInclude is a major element in the XSLT standard.
XSL-FO stands for XSL Formatting Objects. XSL-FO is a markup language for XML document formatting that is most often used to generate PDF files. XSL-FO is a major element in the XSLT standard.

XSL stands for EXtensible Stylesheet Language. XSL is a language for expressing stylesheets. An XSL stylesheet specifies the presentation of a class of XML documents by describing how an instance of the class is transformed into an XML document that uses the formatting vocabulary. XSL is a major element in the XSLT standard.
